intro: Campanula cochleariifolia var. typica, commonly known as the bellflower or blue bell, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade. Campanula cochleariifolia var. typica is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
